FuncDef:
The traffic-eng command enables TE on a specified level for an IS-IS process.
The undo traffic-eng command restores the default settings.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, TE is disabled for an IS-IS process.

ParaDef.Info:
Enables IS-IS TE for a Level-1 area.
-

Enables IS-IS TE for a Level-2 area.
-

Enables IS-IS TE for Level-1 and Level-2 areas.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before you enable TE for an IS-IS process, use the cost-style command in IS-IS view to set the cost type of IS-IS packets to wide, compatible, or wide-compatible.
Prerequisites
After TE is enabled for an IS-IS process, IS-IS sends LSP change information to TE every 3 seconds. As a result, TE data may be updated slowly. To address this issue, run the mpls te tedb fast-notice command. After this configuration, IS-IS immediately sends LSP change information to TE for the first ten times, and then sends LSP change information to TE every 3 seconds.
Precautions
To enable TE for Level-2 in a VPN scenario, configure the VPN instance IPv4 address family first.
